raw_comment: After looking at the graph, I notice that young men are significantly less likely to reach out to a parent using text, video chats, or visiting in person. I wonder why young men seem to be more disconnected from their parents? Does it have to do with the way in which sons tend to be raised in comparison to daughters? This is relevant to members of my community who have young adult sons and daughters who do not live with them. This is also relevant to me because, within a few years, both me and my brother will have moved out, and it will be interesting to see if this pattern is present with us and our parents.
ace_sentences: I noticed a pattern in the graph.
Young men are significantly less likely to reach out to a parent by text.
Young men are significantly less likely to reach out to a parent by video chat.
Young men are significantly less likely to reach out to a parent by visiting in person.
I wonder why young men seem to be more disconnected from their parents.
I wonder whether the way that sons are raised differs from the way that daughters are raised.
I wonder whether this difference causes young men to be more disconnected from their parents.
Some members of my community have young adult sons.
Some members of my community have young adult daughters.
These young adult sons do not live with these members.
These young adult daughters do not live with these members.
This pattern is relevant to these members of my community.
Within a few years, I will have moved out.
Within a few years, my brother will have moved out.
It will be interesting to see whether this pattern is present for me and my parents.
It will be interesting to see whether this pattern is present for my brother and his parents.
